channel.title: pat radio: independent and unsigned bands from Columbus, Ohio
channel.description: pat radio is a weekly showcase of music mostly from central Ohio, mostly from independent labels or unsigned bands.
channel.itunes:author: patradio.org
channel.itunes:subtitle: rock and pop from the Midwest
channel.itunes:summary: pat radio is a weekly showcase of music mostly from central Ohio, mostly from independent labels or unsigned bands.

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - November 17 - Day Creeper
item.description: Aaron of Day Creeper broke three guitar strings last night as the band banged through an eight-song set for my last show on WCRS. He is a beast! Look for a new Day Creeper album in 2012. What else is going on? Sick Thrills is at Carabar tonight, releasing a 7". Them Labs also have a release show tomorrow night at Oldfield's, with The Wells and Outer Spacists. Catch Alwood Sisters at the Rumba on Black Friday (Nov 25). Dane Terry will be all over town for a brief time, playing with various peoples. Dane wants to do another Terry Xmas show at Electraplay, so look for that in the coming weeks on this humble blog (cuz it won't be on the airwaves).
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - September 25 - Lydia Loveless
item.description: Lydia Loveless and her band are my guests this time around. We hear four songs from her new album, Indestructible Machine, performed live at Electraplay. Catch Lydia this Thursday in Cleveland at the Beachland Tavern. She's also doing her Columbus record release this Friday, September 30, at the Rumba Cafe. Lydia is also doing an in-store performance at Lost Weekend Records, prior to the show at the Rumba. A full list of tour dates is here.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus
item.itunes:summary: Lydia Loveless and her band are my guests this time around. We hear four songs from her new album, Indestructible Machine, performed live at Electraplay. Lydia is also doing an in-store performance at Lost Weekend Records, prior to the show at the Rumba. A full list of tour dates is here.

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - September 8 - The Lindsay
item.description: I failed to mention it on the air, but much thanks to Tony Stewart and James Allison at Electrplay for hosting my show again this week and doing all the technical audio things that I have no clue about. They are awesome. The Lindsay is awesome as well, and they played seven songs last night in the studio and you can hear them right now by clicking on the podcast link below. You have two chances to see the Lindsay this weekend, at Carabar tonight and at the Mega City Music Marathon on Saturday. The Townsmen, You're So Bossy, and The Patsys are also on the bill tonight at Carabar. Every band in the world is playing at the MMM on Saturday. Also tonight at Kobo, Indigo Wild releases If By Sea, their debut ep. Playing with them are their Outer Sounds cohorts, Narrow and the Brights, The Blastronauts, and The Town Monster.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - August 25 - Saintseneca
item.description: This show starts with three songs from Saintseneca's first full-length lp entitled Last. Don't miss their Columbus album release show this coming Wednesday night at Wild Goose Creative. They are also playing at the Mega City Marathon on September 10. Urban Scrawl 5 is also happening even as I typed this belated blog entry. Many of the bands playing this now two-day event are featured in the podcast as well.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - August 18 - Maza Blaska
item.description: Sam and Yoni of Maza Blaska are my guests in the first half-hour. We listen to a session Maza Blaska recorded at Electraplay back in April of this year and talk about the beginnings of the band, the pursuit of unique sounds and melodies, and the desire to tell stories on this new record. Indigo Wild, Narrow & the Brights, and Duke Junior and Smokey Boots are also featured, as they are all playing with Maza Blaska at the Storyteller release show tomorrow night at Carabar. Monolithic Cloud Parade's final show is tomorrow night at the Rumba Cafe, and Speed Governor play a show Saturday at the Treehouse, with Flamtronic and In Silent Movies. I finish the show with three classic tunes from Pere Ubu, just because I wanted to hear 'em.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - August 4 - Super Summer Spectacular
item.description: Kyle Siegrist from Lost Weekend Records joins me on this edition of the radio show. It's time once again for Kyle's Lost Weekend Super Summer Spectacular at Ruby Tuesday. Kyle plays tracks from bands playing the two-night extravaganza, including exclusive stuff from Vug and Sundown. He also brings some Columbus rarities along in the form of Post Industrial Noise, Near Paris, and Hairy Bears without Frank Sinatra.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - July 28 - Whoa Nellie!!
item.description: Whoa Nellie!! plays live at Electraplay this week. Pick up a copy of Deep Blue Me at their show with the Flyin' Saucers at Ace of Cups on August 27. Speaking of Ace of Cups, the first two bands to have the honor of rocking out at that club are Scrawl and Exwhites. Check that out this Saturday. I hear it's a free show. If that ain't enough there's a Big Day in Music happening at Woodlands, all day on Saturday. Finally, Civil War Generals have linked a download link to Battle of the Wilderness to the pat radio facebook page. Download it, for it is good.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - July 14 - Moon High live, Volatility Festival
item.description: Moon High play live in the Electraplay studio in the second half of this show. Check out their album release show for Six suns at the Rumba this Saturday night. Volatility Festival, the 10th Annual, is happening on Saturday as well. I play some bands who are entertaining at Volatility this time around.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - July 7 - Parking Lot Blowout, Saturday Giant, Flipper
item.description: The CMC's 6th annual Parking Lot Blowout takes place this Saturday. The first half of this broadcast covers the bands in order of appearance. Joey Hebdo is doing a happy hour set at the Rumba tonight. The Saturday Giant plays with Wing and Tusk at Kobo tomorrow. And Saturday night B.J. of CDR/Necropolis/Vile Gash fame is turning 30. He's celebrating at Carabar by having his friends play Flipper covers. Even I remember Flipper. It was almost...30 years ago...
item.itunes:author: patradio.org

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - June 30, 2011 - TNV, The Lindsay, Day Creep
item.description: Times New Viking roll back into town tomorrow night at the Wexner Center, along with Psandwich, Mike Rep and Tommy Jay. Spd Gvnr is at the Treehouse on Saturday. Rumtum, Shin Tower Music and Alleyes Path are at Carabar on Saturday as well. Plus I sample some of that awesome new lp by the Lindsay and the cassette release from Day Creep (Aaron Troyer of Day Creeper)

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - June 9, 2011 - Bicentennial Bear
item.description: Before the maelstrom that is "summer vacation" started for me, I had Bicentennial Bear in at Electraplay for our first-ever live broadcast. You can hear the results below. There's also live Psandwich, recorded back in February by Sperry, plus new stuff from Raw Milk. I'll post a play list later if I can find the time.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - June 2, 2011
item.description: The Black Swans are releasing Don't Blame the Stars tomorrow night at the Rumba Cafe. There's also a two-night benefit for Joe Peppercorn at the Treehouse tomorrow and Saturday. Please stop in, make a donation, and stay for some awesome rock'n'roll music. Also, Ampline, from Cincinnati, are playing tonight at the Treehouse with The Garrison and Dead Indians. Finally, Organ Grinder Productions are throwing a Sadie Hawkins Dance at 400 Rich to usher the Dewdropper's EP into the world. That's happening on Saturday night. It's June. It's summer. Bring it.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - May 26, 2011
item.description: Don Bovee is celebrating his 69th birthday at Cafe Bourbon Street tomorrow. Kyle Sowash is celebrating his 33rd that same night at the Treehouse. Mat Bisaro and Tony Allman are touring with Dan Melchior in Europe. The Queers are in town Monday night at Carabar. The Electric Grandmother is leaving town, but not before they do one last show at the Treehouse with Kepi Ghoulie on Monday. WCBE is throwing a big bash tonight at Byrne's Pub and Woodlands Tavern, and the Alive has a summer music tour stop at Woodlands on Friday that benefits the Columbus Music Co-op. Whew...wish there was crap to do in this town...
item.itunes:author: patradio.org

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - May 19, 2011
item.description: This night I played a bunch of bands that played Nelsonville last weekend, and, surprise!, are playing in town either tonight, tomorrow, or Saturday. There's other stuff going on this weekend that I spotlight as well. Download and listen.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus
item.itunes:summary: This night I played a bunch of bands that played Nelsonville last weekend, and, surprise!, are playing in town either tonight, tomorrow, or Saturday. There's other stuff going on this weekend that I spotlight as well. Download and listen.

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - May 5, 2011
item.description:
Lots of stuff goin' down musically tonight, tomorrow and Saturday night in Columbus. The Kyle Sowashes have a release party for their "Wreck of the Edmund Fitzgerald" 7" Saturday night at the Summit. Black Owls, Woosley Band, and the Harvest Kings are playing a Cinco de Mayo show tonight at the Treehouse. The Song Birds are releasing a cd at Ravari room on Friday. The Hot 17 is presenting Lord T & Eloise, The Town Monster, and Earwig at Kobo on Friday. Finally, on Saturday at Kobo, it's CMC Volunteer Appreciation night with Alert New London, New Tooth and Energy Clinic.
Next week, Saturday May 14, the Black Box Benefit is happening at Ruby Tuesday. Mors Ontologica is releasing two cds and a split 7" with Marvin the Robot.
So put on your galoshes and get out there!

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - April 28, 2011
item.description: New music from The Regionals, Branden Barnett, and Times New Viking. Old music from Clay, the Yips, and others.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus
item.itunes:summary: New music from The Regionals, Branden Barnett, and Times New Viking. Old music from Clay, the Yips, and others.

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - April 21, 2011
item.description: Phone chat with David James of Wolf Ram Heart, plus lots of great music. Check the link on the wcrs website for free and/or cheap downloads of many of these tracks.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: WCRS Broadcast - March 31, 2011
item.description: I spent some time putting this one together...recording vinyl to my computer, etc. And it's the first show done with my new computer. The ones and zeros just sound...newer. So even though it's about stuff that's already happened, I've decided this show is feed-worthy.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: program 201 - The Wet Darlings
item.description: The Wet Darlings are the first Electraplay session for 2011. We hear four songs and chat about the songwriting process and metaphor. Ghost Shirt and Yellow Light Maybe are also on this podcast. They're both playing with The Wet Darlings at their cd release show this Friday, March 18 at Skully's.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus
item.itunes:summary: The Wet Darlings are the first Electraplay session for 2011. We hear four songs and chat about the songwriting process and metaphor. Ghost Shirt and Yellow Light Maybe are also on this podcast. They're both playing with The Wet Darlings at their cd release show this Friday, March 18 at Skully's.

item.title: program 200 - Dane Terry
item.description: Dane Terry joins us at Electraplay for four songs and some chattin'. He's off to New York City, so go see his farewell performance tonight at Carabar. There's also music from Day Creeper, Time and Temperature, and Nathan Snell's Country Band, plus a rendition of "O' Holy Night" by Brainbow, which comes from A Very Ohio Christmas which you can find on bandcamp. 100% of the proceeds go to Gracehaven House. Buy it. Do it. Now.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

Buy it. Do it. Now.
item.itunes:keywords: Dane Terry, Nathan Snell, Time and Temperature

item.title: program 199 - Phantods
item.description: Phantods are the in-studio guests this week. They play five songs from their soon-to-be-released cd, Creature. There's also new music from Black Owls, who are doing a release show this Friday for June '71. Paul Nini of Old 3C Records also joins me to talk about the Beetkeepers reunion show coming up in December. We also listen to new Old 3C releases from Randall Douglas Matson and the Malefactors of Great Wealth.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: program 198 - Nick Tolford & Company
item.description: Nick Tolford & Company are the in-studio guest this week. The band is releasing its first full-length album, Extraordinary Love, at Carabar, Saturday October 9. We also hear music from release-show guests The Compressions, ExWhites, and Holiday Mary. Harvest Kings are also releasing a cd tomorrow, Friday October 8, at Hal and Al's. We hear two songs from Cardboard Crowns by the Harvest Kings. Special thanks, as always, to James Allison and Tim Race of Electraplay Productions for recording and mixing this week's in-studio session.
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: program 197 - Earwig
item.description: Amy D, of madebyAmyD.com fame, is the guest emcee this time around. She interviews Lizard McGee, and George and Constan Hondroulis of the band Earwig. Lizard talks about the Rapture, the Holocaust, a magical dwarf, and how his dreams inspire his songs. We hear five songs performed live from Gibson Under Mountain plus one new tune. Also, Amy has a fashion show happening at Wholly Craft! tomorrow night, October 1, 2010
item.itunes:author: patradio.org
item.itunes:subtitle: cool music from Columbus

item.title: program 196 - Monolithic Cloud Parade, The Lost Revival
item.description: Corey Fry from Monolithic Cloud Parade and Kevin Collins from The Lost Revival chat about their new records, which will be released at a show tomorrow at Skully's.

item.title: program 195 - Fort Shame, The Compressions, Marvin the Robot
item.description: This program features interviews and music from Sue Harshe of Fort Shame, Mark Himmel of The Compressions, and Miles Curtiss of Marvin the Robot.

item.title: program 194 - Lost Weekend Records Super Summer Spectacular
item.description: Kyle of Lost Weekend Records stops by with Chris Barton of the Skilletlickers to hype the Super Summer Spectacular, happening at Ruby Tuesday. Pat also plays bands that are featured at the Pabst Rendezvous, Part Deux.

item.title: program 193 - The Mooncussers
item.description: The Mooncussers have a cd release tomorrow, Friday August 13, at the Rumba Cafe. Hear four songs live in the studio from the Mooncussers on this week's program. Special thanks to James Allison and Tim Race at Electraplay Productions for recording and mixing the session.
